title.narrative: WH2-SANITATION IN COMMUNITIES & INSTITUTIONS

description.narrative: By 2021, children, families of communities and institutions (schools and FOSA) in the intervention zones, have functional and accessible sanitary facilities., which contributes to Sanitation, Sanitation (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: People living in disadvantaged areas, especially women and children and people affected by emergencies, use safe, affordable sanitation facilities and adopt good hygiene practices.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, children, families of communities and institutions (schools and FOSA) in the intervention zones, have functional and accessible sanitary facilities.

description.narrative: 228 villages representing 76% of targeted villages, reached the Open Defecation Free status. Among these ODF villages, 228 are pending certifications by the government. The 228 ODF-certified villages cover 135,768 people. Also, 7,672 school children from 17 schools and 300 patients of one health center have access to improved sanitation facilities. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:26/12/2019
